import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

plt.rcParams['figure.figsize'] = [15,8]
plt.rcParams['axes.spines.right'] = False
plt.rcParams['axes.spines.top'] = False

import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

source.8f11b4ec:
def plot_genre_horizontal_bar(col, title=None):
    data = df.groupby('genre')[col].mean().sort_values()

    cmap = plt.cm.coolwarm_r
    norm = plt.Normalize(vmin=data.min(), vmax=data.max())
    colors = [cmap(norm(value)) for value in data]

    data.plot.barh(color=colors)
    plt.xlabel(col)
    plt.title(title, fontdict={'size': 18, 'color': '#de5d83'})
    plt.show()

                          title="Average Danceability in each genre")

corr_mat = df[numerical_cols].corr()

sns.heatmap(corr_mat,
            annot=True,
            fmt='.2f',
            cmap=plt.cm.coolwarm_r,
            mask=np.triu(corr_mat, k=0))
plt.show()
source.b03a6980: - Songs in genre "trap", "psytrance", "hardstyle", "trance", or "dnb" have the highest energy, and RnB, Rap, or Underground Rap lowest.
source.bc251280: - 'Danceability' has positive correlation with 'valence' feature. - 'Energy' has positive correlation with 'loudness', 'instrumentalness', 'liveness', and 'time duration'. - 'Instrumentalness' has positive correlation with 'time duration'.
source.fa33b72a: - "Trance" and "psytrance" are the top genres with liveness scores.
source.04b9636c: - Songs in the genre 'techhouse' have the maximum average danceability, followed by underground Rap. And hardstyle songs have minimum danceability.
source.e2114acb: - Songs in genre 'RnB' have the minimum acousticness score and followed by Hiphop and Rap.
source.81aefd59: - In both modes, Underground Rap has the maximum number of instances.
source.4d32e0ad:
##
Song Genre and Time Duration
source.24c19851: - The 'techno' genre songs have the maximum instrumentalness score, followed by 'psytrance' genre.
source.9e773ab1: Spotify is a big music platform. It has songs of various genres. The data I’m going to use in this project only has 15 genres. The goal here is to analyze all the genres with different features and check how they relate to genres.
source.81a15230: - Except for 'time-signature' 4, all have the maximum number of instances in the 'Dark Trap' genre. Underground Rap has the maximum number of instances in the 'time-signature' 4.
source.046ebb28: - Tempo score the highest for 'dnb' genre followed by 'Hiphop' genre. And 'techhouse' has the lowest.
source.87da20c7: - The valence bis maximum for 'techhouse' genre followed by Pop and minimum for 'techno' and 'trance'.
source.b023dfc0: - Data contains only a few instances of ‘time signature’ 1, 3, and 5. Most instances are 4 ‘time signature’. - Underground Rap has the maximum number, and Pop has the minimum number of instances.
source.27576849:
##
Song Genre and Time Signature
source.eae1a91a: - Songs in genres 'psytrance' and 'techno' are the longest than all other genres.
source.e7309a45: - Songs in all genres have loudness scores in negatives. "Trap" genre has the highest "loudness", and "techno" genre lowest.
source.ac505bfb: - Danceability follows an approximately normal distribution. - Energy feature if negatively skewed. - The loudness feature is normally distributed with a few outliers. - The number of instances with mode 1 is greater than mode 0. - The Speechiness feature is positively skewed, meaning the 'speechiness' feature's mean is greater than the median. - 'Acousticness', 'instrumentalness', 'liveness', and valence features are all p[olsitively skewed. - The "temp" and "duration_ms" features seem to have a normal distribution.
source.7d4d2811: - Underground Rap, Rap, and Hiphop are the top-3 genres for “speechiness”, and trance, techno, and psytrance are the lowest.
